segments.text: Ugh, what a mess with that sink gushing water all over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle's spreading, soaking everything in sight—gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing right in it, oblivious, like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those cabinet doors dripping wet; it'll warp the wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids, filthy hands in the cookie jar while the floor's a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's balancing on that rickety stool—disaster waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Girl's just standing there, probably tracking dirt into the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes piled up, soon to be contaminated by the spill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window's open, but it won't air out this stench of neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her towel's bunched up; bet it's damp from the splash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cookies in an open jar—now they'll get soggy from the humidity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen's turning into a pigsty right before my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR
